result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle A Larsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to probation by 3:00 PM, Thursday, July 21, 2016. Probation shall not be transferred out of state. If Defendant wishes to leave the State, the matter must be brought before the Court as it will not be at the discretion of the probation agent.
Concurrent with: 13CF43

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must obtain and maintain employment. If unemployed or underemployed must seek work per the guidelines of the Child Support Agency.

Must not cancel, alter or modify the assignment of her per capita to the Child Support Agency unless the court approves same. Must pay child support and arrears in full and on time.

04/24/17 AMENDED PER COURTS ORDER THAT THE DEFENDANT MUST REINSTATE ASSIGNMENT OF HER $200.00 BI-WEEKLY PER CAPITA PAYMENTS FROM THE ST. CROIX CHIPPEWA INDIANS OF WISCONSIN TO THE WISCONSIN CHILD SUPPORT TRUST FUND. THIS ASSIGNMENT MUST OCCUR NO LATER THAN APRIL 24, 2017. THIS ASSIGNMENT SHALL CONTINUE UNTIL THE DEFENDANT HAS SATISFIED ALL OF HER CHILD SUPPORT ARREARS WHILE MAINTAINING HER CURRENT SUPPORT OBLIGATIONS. THE DEFENDANT WILL NOT CANCEL, ALTER OR MODIFY THIS ASSIGNMENT OF HER PER CAPITA PAYMENTS WITHOUT OBTAINING PRIOR COURT APPROVAL, FOR WHICH GOOD CAUSE MUST BE SHOWN.

12/22/17 AMENDED PER COURTS ORDER THAT THE DEFENDANT MUST MAKE ALL CHILD SUPPORT PAYMENTS IN FULL AND ON TIME DEFENDANT MUST CONTINUE PAYING CHILD SUPPORT ARREARS BY USING ALL AVAILABLE PER CAPITA PAYMENTS FROM THE ST. CROIX CHIPPEWA INDIANS OF WISCONSIN TO PAY THE WISCONSIN CHILD SUPPORT TRUST FUND FOR ARREARS. THE DEFENDANT WILL NOT CANCEL, ALTER OR MODIFY THIS ASSIGNMENT OF HER PER CAPITA PAYMENTS. DEFENDANT SHALL CONTACT THE TRIBAL HOUSING DEPARTMENT REGARDING THE FEE BEING TAKEN OUT AND MUST VERIFY THE DEDUCTIONS ARE APPROPRIATE TODAY. DEFENDANT MUST USE FUNDS FROM HER JOB CURRENTLY AT SANMINA TO MAKE CHILD SUPPORT PAYMENTS, WHICH IS IN ADDITION TO THE PER CAP PAYMENT IN FULL AND ON TIME. COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT FOR HER EMPLOYER WITH CHILD SUPPORT.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 87 days credit if revoked.

supervisions.notes: Court grants Huber for all purposes (work search, work, child care, and court proceedings). Good time is granted.
Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked - sentence is imposed.

Defendant Michelle A Larsen in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Defendant Michelle A Larsen in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 13CF43 AND 15CF387. 

15CF387: Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Court finds Defendant guilty. Count 2 - DRI. Court orders PSI. Sentence hearing set for 1/8/16 at 2:00 p.m. for 1 hour. Court amends bond from $5,000 cash bond to $5,000 signature bond with conditions that Defendant assign the entirety of her future per capita payments from the St. Croix Chippewa Indians of WI to the WI Support Collections Trust Fund, and that Defendant may not leave the State of Wisconsin without the Court's permission.

Defendant will reside at 2583 2 5/8th Street in Cumberland, WI 54829. Defendant gives her mother's phone # in Court (715-419-0952).

13CF43: Probation review hearing adjourned to same date as sentence hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Defendant must assign the entirety of her future per capita payments from the St. Croix Chippewa Indians of WI to the WI Support Collections Trust Fund.
Defendant may not leave the State of Wisconsin without the Court's permission.
to $5,000.00 signature bond
